data.title: Final Four Hawks Alumni
data.meta_description: Find out which Hawks alumni played for one of the current Final Four teams and vote on who you think will win today!
data.text:
Since the NCAA Final Four is tonight, we thought it would be fun to give you a list of Hawks players who used to play for one of the colleges in the Final Four as well as a chance to vote on who you think will win!

A few fun facts:

Kentucky has the most former Atlanta Hawks with seven, then Duke with six, Michigan State with four, and Wisconsin with just two.

Despite having less than Kentucky and Duke, Michigan State has the most cumulative seasons played as an Atlanta Hawk with 23 seasons, followed by Duke with 12, Kentucky with 10, and Wisconsin with five.

Only in 13 of the 47 seasons since the Hawks moved to Atlanta have the Hawks not had a player from one of the Final Four colleges this year (1968-71, 1972-76, 1977-78, 2001-04, 2010-2012).

Notes: I counted playing any part of a season as a season played for a team, and this only takes into account players who played for the Atlanta Hawks, not any previous Hawks team.

Listed in order of when they last played for the Hawks, starting with present and working back:

Elton Brand

College: Duke

College Years: 1997-99 (2 seasons)

Came to Hawks via: Free Agency

Hawks Years:2013-present (2 seasons)

Devin Harris

College: Wisconsin

College Years: 2001-04 (3 seasons)

Came to Hawks via: Trade with Utah Jazz

Hawks Years: 2012-13 (1 season)

Dahntay Jones

College: Duke

College Years: 2001-03 (2 seasons, transferred from Rutgers)

Came to Hawks via: Trade with Dallas Mavericks

Hawks Years: 2012-13 (1 season)

Randolph Morris

College: Kentucky

College Years: 2004-07 (3 seasons)

Came to Hawks via: Free Agency

Hawks Years: 2008-10 (2 seasons)

Shelden Williams

College: Duke

College Years: 2002-06 (4 seasons)

Came to Hawks via: Draft

Hawks Years: 2006-08 (2 seasons)

Tony Delk

College: Kentucky

College Years: 1992-96 (4 seasons)

Came to Hawks via: Trade with Dallas Mavericks

Hawks Years: 2004-06 (2 seasons)

Antoine Walker

College: Kentucky

College Years: 1994-96 (2 seasons)

Came to Hawks via: Trade with Dallas Mavericks

Hawks Years: 2004-05 (1 season)

Anthony Miller

College: Michigan State

College Years: 1991-94 (3 seasons)

Came to Hawks via: Free Agency (multiple times)

Hawks Years: 1996-98, 2000-01, 2004-05 (4 seasons)

Kevin Willis

College: Michigan State

College Years: 1981-84 (3 seasons)

Came to Hawks via: Draft (1984), Free Agency (2004)

Hawks Years: 1984-95, 2004-05 (12 seasons)

Nazr Mohammed

College: Kentucky

College Years: 1995-98 (3 seasons)

Came to Hawks via: Trade with Philadelphia 76ers

Hawks Years: 2004-05 (1 season)

Roshown McLeod

College: Duke

College Years: 1996-98 (2 seasons, transferred from St. John's)

Came to Hawks via: Draft

Hawks Years: 1998-2001 (3 seasons)

Jeff Sheppard

College: Kentucky

College Years: 1993-98 (4 seasons, did not play 1996-97)

Came to Hawks via: Free Agency

Hawks Years: 1998-99 (1 season)

Steve Smith

College: Michigan State

College Years: 1987-91 (4 seasons)

Came to Hawks via: Trade with Miami Heat

Hawks Years: 1994-99 (5 seasons)

Christian Laettner

College: Duke

College Years: 1988-92 (4 seasons)

Came to Hawks via: Trade with Minnesota Timberwolves

Hawks Years: 1995-98 (3 seasons)

Wes Matthews (Sr)

College: Wisconsin

College Years: 1977-80 (4 seasons)

Came to Hawks via: Trade with Washington Bullets

Hawks Years: 1980-84 (4 seasons)

Terry Furlow

College: Michigan State

College Years: 1972-76(4 seasons)

Came to Hawks via: Trade with Cleveland Cavaliers

Hawks Years: 1978-80 (2 seasons)

Jack Givens

College: Kentucky

College Years: 1974-78 (4 seasons)

Came to Hawks via: Free Agency

Hawks Years: 1978-80 (2 seasons)

Randy Denton

College: Duke

College Years: 1968-71(3 seasons)

Came to Hawks via: Trade with New York Knicks

Hawks Years: 1976-77 (1 season)

Tom Payne

College: Kentucky

College Years: 1970-71(1 season)

Came to Hawks via: Draft

Hawks Years: 1971-72 (1 season)

Be sure to vote below on who you think will win the Final Four!
